intro: Erythranthe inflata, commonly known as the inflated filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Erythranthe inflata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
